Expectation1: Perform maintenance and cleaning of the machines to ensure optimal performance
Situation1: A few machines are running hotter than normal after missing their last service window.
Expectation2: Engage in spiritual study and reflection
Situation2: The weekly study circle meets tonight to discuss a chapter they have not yet reviewed.
Story: I stared at the blinking red lights on the control panel, the hum of the machines growing louder, almost agitated. They’d missed their last service window, and now a few were running hotter than I’d ever seen. My supervisor’s words echoed in my mind: “We can’t afford downtime. Stay late if you have to.” I wiped my hands on my overalls, feeling the grit of oil and worry. But tonight was also the weekly study circle at the temple, the one time each week I could sit with others and reflect on the teachings, let the noise of the world fall away. We were supposed to discuss a new chapter, one I hadn’t even read yet. The thought of missing it made my chest tighten; I needed that peace, that sense of connection. Yet, the machines demanded my attention, their needs as urgent as any prayer. I stood in the middle of the workshop, torn between the clamor of metal and the quiet call of the Dharma, feeling the weight of both worlds pressing in.
